greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = (4n-4k+1) * T(n-1,k-1) + (4k-3) * T(n-1,k).
comment: This is the case m=4 of a group of triangles defined by the recursion T(n,k,m) = (m*n-m*k+1) *T(n-1,k-1) + (m*k-m+1)* T(n - 1, k).
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..11325 (rows 1 <= n <= 150, flattened).
Nick Early, Honeycomb tessellations and canonical bases for permutohedral blades, arXiv:1810.03246 [math.CO], 2018.
G. Strasser, Generalisation of the Euler adic, Math. Proc. Camb. Phil. Soc. 150 (2010) 241-256, Triangle A_4(n,k).
formula: The row polynomials R(n,u) are related to the row polynomials P(n,u) of A186492 via R(n+1,u) = (-i)^n *(1-u)^n *P(n,i*(1+u)/(1-u)), where i = sqrt(-1). (End)
maple: A142459 := proc(n, k) if n = k then 1; elif k > n or k < 1 then 0 ; else (4*n-4*k+1)*procname(n-1, k-1)+(4*k-3)*procname(n-1, k) ; end if; end proc:
program: [[T(n, k) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 12 2020
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Sep 19 2008
